question.text: What is the moment of inertia of a solid sphere of mass M and radius R about an axis passing through its center?
Which of the following expressions represents the angular momentum of a rotating body?
A disc of radius 0.5 m and mass 2 kg is rotating with an angular velocity of 4 rad/s. What is its angular momentum?
A cylindrical rod of length L and mass M is rotated about an axis through one end. What is its moment of inertia?
A wheel with a radius of 0.3 m is spinning at 20 rad/s. What is the linear speed of a point on the edge of the wheel?
If the angular velocity of a wheel changes from 10 rad/s to 20 rad/s in 5 seconds, what is the angular acceleration?
A solid cylinder rolls without slipping down an incline. If the incline is at an angle θ and the cylinder has a radius R, what is the acceleration of its center of mass?
A flywheel with a moment of inertia of 0.5 kg m² is rotating at 12 rad/s. How much torque is needed to stop it in 4 seconds?
A child of mass 30 kg is sitting at a distance of 2 m from the pivot point of a seesaw. What is the torque exerted by the child if the seesaw is horizontal?
What is the centripetal acceleration of an object moving in a circle of radius 5 m at a speed of 10 m/s?
A satellite is in a circular orbit around Earth at a distance of 7000 km from the center of the Earth. What is its orbital speed?
A torque of 20 Nm is applied to a wheel with a moment of inertia of 5 kg m². What is the angular acceleration of the wheel?
What is the kinetic energy of a rotating disk of moment of inertia 2 kg m² spinning at 10 rad/s?
A ring of radius 1 m and mass 1 kg is rolling on a flat surface without slipping. What is the total kinetic energy when it is rolling at 4 m/s?
A barbell weighing 150 N rests on a pivot 1 m from one end. Calculate the torque due to the weight of the barbell if it is 0.5 m from the pivot.
Two rigid bodies have moment of inertia 2 kg m² and 3 kg m² respectively. If both are rotating with the same angular velocity of 5 rad/s, what is the total angular momentum?
Which of the following has the greatest moment of inertia: a solid cylinder, hollow cylinder, or a solid sphere, all having the same mass and radius?
A boat is moving at a constant speed in a circle of radius 100 m. If the speed of the boat is 10 m/s, what is the centripetal acceleration?
A dancer spins with an angular velocity of 3 rad/s. If she pulls her arms in, her moment of inertia decreases to half its original value. What will be her new angular velocity?
A mass of 4 kg is attached to a string and is swinging in a circle of radius 2 m. What is the tension in the string if the speed is 8 m/s?
A 1.5 kg ball is rotating in a circle of radius 0.8 m at a speed of 6 m/s. What is the centripetal force acting on the ball?
If the moment of inertia of a flywheel is halved, what happens to the angular momentum if angular velocity remains constant?
A pendulum of length 1 m swings back and forth. What is its period of oscillation?
A block of mass 2 kg is attached to a spring and oscillates with a period of 0.5 s. What is the spring constant?
A car with a mass of 1000 kg rounds a curve of radius 30 m at a speed of 15 m/s. What is the centripetal force acting on the car?
A uniform disc is rotating about an axis through its center. If its angular speed is doubled, what is the effect on its rotational kinetic energy?
A solid sphere is rolling down an incline. If it starts from rest, what fraction of its total mechanical energy is kinetic energy when it reaches the bottom?
A flywheel requires 15 Nm of torque to accelerate from rest to 200 rad/s in 10 seconds. What is its moment of inertia?
A solid cylinder is rotating with angular velocity of 10 rad/s and it experiences a torque of 2 Nm. What is the time taken to stop it?
What is the work done in rotating a solid sphere of radius R through an angle θ?
